meanings.definition: Not able to be disputed or questioned.
meanings.sent1: The fact that the sun rises every morning is incontestable.
meanings.sent2: Her victory in the race was incontestable; she crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: It is incontestable that cats rule the internet with their adorable videos.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the twins was incontestable, like two halves of a whole.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience with her students was incontestable, never losing her cool even in challenging situations.

meanings.sent1: The evidence presented in court was incontestable, leaving no doubt of his guilt.
meanings.sent2: The incontestable fact that water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius is well-known.
meanings.sent3: It was incontestable that the clown's attempt at juggling was a hilarious disaster.
meanings.sent4: The incontestable beauty of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The incontestable logic of her argument convinced everyone in the room.
